dmcintyre, files delivered as *.RAR is very nice. if there's an error during download, u can delete and re-download just that small part instead of the whole movie, image or whatever. Not everyone has a fast connection.

WinRaR is free (well, nag-ware) and there are other alternatives, heck I think even Xp has a built in tool able to handle those files. 

If you are unable to see why it is useful, then go take a basic computer skill class.

vinnienonose... i'm not sure about Nero but i do it using Virtualdub and the Subtitler plugin. I recompress the whole movie so it includes hard-encoded subs. That's to watch on a computer, though, not on TV. You can always recompress it again then to burn on a DVD if that's what you want. Not much quality is lost in recompressing a movie these days.

But, um, wait, isn't this movie in English..? Of course, virtualdub will work with any language subs.

But I recommend you also download a 'GOM' player too. Plays everything. Last thing, although downloading the Divx stuff is essential, you must download a AC3filter.

Anyhoo, having these three are great. Even if you just get the Divx stuff and the AC3filter all your movies will play in the windows media player. But with the GOM player I never use WMP.
